review: you must enable "1-Click Purchases" on your account to install apps like Netflix and Hulu on your device. If you're like me, you will forget to change that setting back after installing your apps. Then, if you use the built-in search feature, you WILL be shown the paid options (if available from Amazon) FIRST instead of the free versions if available from other content providers. Example: Yo Gabba Gabba Holiday Special HD is FREE on Hulu, but $4.99 on Amazon Instant Video. I use Hulu on my iPad to play this for my daughter so I know its free, but I ALMOST paid $4.99 on the Fire Stick because of this little tactic, fortunately I noticed the wording "Included with Amazon Prime for 0.00" was replaced by "Add to watchlist" and if you click Play on this screen, the video will immediately play and your account charged, no confirmation page or anything because remember, you were forced to enable 1 click purchases. VERY shady Amazon but I caught you and am letting others know!
